title: Tracking tropics | Tropical Storm Ernesto forms in the Atlantic , warnings issued from Leeward Islands to Puerto Rico
message:
Tropical Storm Ernesto forms in the Atlantic, expected to impact Puerto Rico by midweek: NHCRALEIGH, N.C. (WTVD) -- Tropical Storm Ernesto formed in the Atlantic Ocean on Monday afternoon.
The storm is expected to bring tropical conditions to the Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico by Wednesday, according to the National Hurricane Center (NHC).
Ernesto could impact Bermuda but it's too soon to tell, the NHC said in a social media post.
On Sunday night, ABC11 Meteorologist Robert Johnson said the storm could move near Puerto Rico by midweek and curve north toward Bermuda as a hurricane between Thursday and Friday.
Hurricane Debby, which entered North Carolina as a tropical storm, weakened into a tropical depression, has moved out of the U.S. over the weekend.

title: Tropical Storm Warnings Issued For Puerto Rico , U . S . Virgin Islands
message:
Tropical Storm warnings have been issued for Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands as Potential Tropical Cyclone Five churns in the Atlantic Ocean.
The cyclone is forecast to strengthen into Tropical Storm Ernesto by Tuesday (August 13) as it moves west toward the Leeward Islands.
"On the forecast track, the disturbance is expected to move across portions of the Leeward Islands late tonight or Tuesday and approach the U.S. and British Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico Tuesday evening," the National Hurricane Center said.
Meteorologists are warning the storm could bring up to ten inches of flooding rains and damaging winds to Puerto Rico before heading north and strengthening into a hurricane later in the week.
Most forecast models show the storm system will stay away from the East Coast of the U.S. as it strengthens in the mid-Atlantic.

title: Pee Dee residents return to flooded homes , cars after evacuating for Debby
message:
BENNETTSVILLE, SC (WMBF) - After leaving their homes during Tropical Storm Debby, residents returned to survey the damage left in the storm’s wake.
Covington was one of many residents who evacuated when they saw the water rising during Tropical Storm Debby last week.
“The reason why we left is because the water was coming out the creek and into the yard,” said Covington.
Covington has lived in Bennettsville for over 40 years and said Hurricane Hugo destroyed her home back in 1989.
Down here is the worst.”“They keep saying that for 30 years, and they an’t fixed no problem yet.”[<mos><itemID>10</itemID><itemSlug>ALI: MARLBORO CO. title: Warnings issued for US territories as Tropical Storm Ernesto forms in Atlantic
message:
Tropical Storm Ernesto gained strength into a named storm Monday afternoon in the Atlantic, where it threatens Caribbean communities with wind, rain and storm surge.
It was close to 600 miles east-southeast of Puerto Rico, moving west-northwest at 28mph.
Tropical storm warnings were in effect Monday for Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands.
5pm AST August 12th -- Here are the latest Key Messages for now Tropical Storm #Ernesto.
Expected to bring tropical storm conditions to portions of Leeward Islands tonight & tomorrow, moving into the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico by late Tuesday.

title: Tropical storm Ernesto will dry us out this weekend
message:
Tropical storm Ernesto has developed east of the NE Caribbean and is expected to slowly consolidate into a hurricane once it passes the Islands.
A storm system or trough of low pressure off the coast of the mid Atlantic coast will keep Ernesto away from the mainland of the United States.
This will bring our rain chances down to less than 20%.
This weekend the rain chances go down below 20% for the coast and only 20% inland.
Dry air settles in for the weekend due to Ernesto (WWSB)Copyright 2024 WWSB.

title: The Future is Uninsurable ? Hardly
message:
Insure our Future is backed by the Connecticut Citizens Action Group, whose mission statement is to “actively engage the residents of Connecticut in altering the relations of power in order to bring about environmental, economic, and social justice.”The “uninsurable future” crowd is mainly on the left, but needn’t be.
Analysis to determine whether or not the future is uninsurable presupposes that we know what the future will hold.
But there is data to support the contention that, whatever the future brings, it does not constitute an existential threat to the insurance industry.
Insurance Capital and Alternative CapitalThe property and casualty insurance industry had $2.7 trillion in assets at year-end 2023.
The federal government has already botched its management of two insurance programs – federal flood insurance and crop insurance.

title: Nankei Trough advisory : Japan is bracing for a once - in - a - century earthquake . Does it need to ?
message:
A special committee warned that another “major earthquake” could hit in the coming week – the first time in its history the body had issued this type of nationwide advisory.
Then there’s the looming threat of the Nankai Trough megathrust earthquake – the most powerful of its kind, with magnitudes that can exceed 9.
Japan’s government has warned of the possible Nankai Trough quake for so many years that the possibility of it occurring has become common knowledge.
The ‘big one’The Nankai Trough is a 700-kilometer long (435-mile) subduction zone, which refers to when tectonic plates slip beneath each other.
“I tell (my students), the Nankai Trough earthquake will definitely come, whether it’s your generation or your children’s generation,” he said.

title: It so bad and so heartbreaking : River flooding affecting Pee Dee homeowners after Debby
message:
MARION COUNTY, SC (WMBF) -The town of Nichols continues to cope with the aftereffects of Tropical Storm Debby.
Rogers said the town had an opportunity to get ahead of some of the issues with flooding with preventative measures.
Down the road, Bernice Britt is used to traveling the Little Pee Dee River in a boat but is now wading through the water in her front yard.
After consulting a few friends, Britt said she decided to self-evacuate as the river continues to rise.
The WMBF First Alert Weather Team continues to monitor the river levels, the latest details can be found here.

title: We Have Tropical Storm Ernesto : The Alabama Weather Blog
message:
Tropical Storm Ernesto has now officially formed, with a center of circulation and deep convection gradually organizing in bands around the storm.
WARNINGS——–The current warnings in effect for Tropical Storm Ernesto include:– Tropical Storm Warnings are in effect for St. Kitts, Nevis, Montserrat, Antigua, Barbuda, Anguilla, Guadeloupe, St. Martin, St. Barthelemy, Sint Maarten, the British Virgin Islands, the U.S. Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, Vieques, and Culebra.
These warnings indicate that tropical storm conditions are expected within these areas within the next 36 hours.
Residents in these areas should prepare for tropical storm conditions, including strong winds, heavy rainfall, potential flash flooding, and storm surge impacts.
BERMUDA——-Bermuda is expected to experience a major impact from Tropical Storm Ernesto, with the most severe conditions forecasted for Saturday, August 17th.

title: Puerto Rico Cancels Classes , Activates National Guard as Tropical Storm Ernesto Approaches
message:
Tropical storm warnings were in effect for Puerto Rico, Vieques, Culebra, the U.S. and British Virgin Islands, Antigua, Barbuda, Anguilla, St. Kitts, Nevis, Montserrat, Guadeloupe, St. Martin, St. Barts and St. Maarten.
The National Hurricane Center said Ernesto is forecast to move over or near Puerto Rico and the U.S. and British Virgin Islands on Tuesday evening.
Puerto Rico Gov.

Power outages also were a concern in the neighboring U.S. Virgin Islands for similar reasons.

title: Get ready for more wildfires and hurricanes : Environment Canada
message:
Human-caused climate change is making heat waves much more likely, the federal government says, bringing extreme weather from fires to storms.
That's according to Environment and Climate Change Canada's rapid extreme weather event attribution system, which compares today's climate to a pre-industrial one.
Natural Resources Minister Jonathan Wilkinson said there will be more wildfires from British Columbia to Manitoba this month, with climate change fuelling them.
"It is not unusual for Western Canada to see high levels of fire activity this time of year," he said at a press conference on Monday.
Get ready for more floods, fires and hurricanes as climate change clobbers Canada.

title: Tropical Storm Ernesto forms in the Atlantic
message:
BRYAN, Texas (KBTX) - Tropical Storm Erneto has formed roughly 300 miles east of the island of Antigua in the Lesser Antilles.
Tropical storm conditions are expected across the northern Leeward Islands through midweek, with a landfall for Puerto Rico possible.
The good news, however, is as this storm potentially strengthens to a hurricane, we are expecting it to curve away from the Lower 48 of the US thanks to the jetstream.
2024 Hurricane Names - 5 names storms so far (kbtx)Ernesto becomes the fifth named storm of the 2024 Atlantic hurricane season.
Copyright 2024 KBTX.

title: Do you remember  Four in  04 ? 10 years ago , four hurricanes hit Florida in six weeks – NBC 6 South Florida
message:
The Hurricane season is on.
The 2004 Hurricane season delivered four hits to Florida in a matter of 6 weeks.
Hurricane Jeanne became the sixth major hurricane of the relentless 2004 season, making landfall on the Florida’s Treasure Coast, Sept. 25.
Use this knowledge today and for everyone storm season ahead.
Yet, more importantly, it’s a reminder that hurricane season can be unforgiving.

title: EMO to meet as Tropical Storm Ernesto strengthens
message:
Tropical Storm Ernesto, previously known as Potential Tropical Cyclone Five, was situated in the southern Caribbean when the Bermuda Weather Service issued its 6pm update, with maximum sustained winds of about 46mph.
By early Wednesday morning, Ernesto was expected to strengthen into a strong tropical storm and move over the US and British Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico.
The US National Hurricane Centre said today that tropical storm warnings were in effect for the Leeward Islands, the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico.
Despite weakening into a tropical storm immediately after passing over Florida, the storm unleashed floods and tornadoes, and has so far claimed seven lives and created about $12 billion worth of damages.
To monitor the path of Tropical Storm Ernesto, visit the BWS website.

title: 4 . 4 magnitude earthquake hits Los Angeles area
message:
A powerful earthquake struck near Los Angeles, California on Monday afternoon, shaking homes and startling residents for miles.
The 4.4 magnitude quake's epicentre hit near Highland Park, a neighbourhood in Los Angeles County not far from the famous Hollywood sign and the Griffith Observatory, at around 12:20 PST (20:20 BST), according to the US Geological Survey.
The Los Angeles Fire Department said crews from the city's 106 fire stations were doing a complete survey of the Greater Los Angeles area for structural damage or other issues.
The earthquake was first estimated as a 4.7 magnitude, but was later downgraded to a 4.4 magnitude by the US Geological Survey.
The area has seen several magnitude 4 and 5 earthquakes in recent weeks, including in Grapevine and Bakersfield, California last week.

title: Tropical Storm Ernesto forms - heading toward Puerto Rico
message:
GREENVILLE, S.C. (FOX Carolina) - Tropical Storm Ernesto has formed and is expected to bring rain and wind to Puerto Rico, then hurricane conditions to Bermuda.
Tropical storm warning is in effect for St. Kitts, Nevis, Antigua, Barbuda, Anguilla, Guadeloupe, St. Martin and St. Barthelemy and Sint Maarten.
This means tropical storm conditions are expected somewhere within these areas within 36 hours.
Headed to Puerto Rico (Fox Carolina)Tropical storm conditions are likely for British Virgin Islands, U.S. Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, Vieques and Culebra.
The storm is expected to track through the Leeward Islands, expected to make a turn north either Wednesday or Thursday after moving near Puerto Rico.

title: Tropical Storm Ernesto to bring rain , flooding to Puerto Rico : Path
message:
(NEW YORK) — The next tropical system is forming in the Atlantic and is forecast to strengthen into Tropical Storm Ernesto before it reaches the eastern and northern Caribbean.
A tropical storm watch has been issued for Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, where up to 10 inches of rain and flash flooding are possible Tuesday night through Wednesday.
After hitting Puerto Rico, most computer models show Ernesto strengthening into a hurricane.
Ernesto is forecast to move east of the U.S. mainland and approach Bermuda by Friday night into Saturday morning.
Ernesto is expected to bring rough surf and rip currents to the East Coast next weekend, but it isn’t forecast to make landfall on the U.S. mainland.

title: Another hurricane predicted to form in the South Atlantic | Hurricane Wire
message:
With flooding, tornadoes, damaged roads and potentially weakened dams left in the wake of Tropical Storm Debby, another weather disturbance tracking across the South Atlantic could be anxiety inducing.
Fortunately, the predicted course of the storm, referred to as Potential Tropical Cyclone Five, appears to pose no threat to the United States.
As early as Aug. 13, the disturbance could strengthen into Tropical Storm Ernesto, which would be the fifth named storm of the 2024 season.
Colorado State University has revised its forecast for the 2024 hurricane season.
A major hurricane is rated as a Category 3 or higher, with sustained winds of 111 mph or more.

title: Texas launches new investigation into Houston power utility following deadly outages after Beryl
message:
AUSTIN, Texas – Texas' attorney general launched an investigation Monday into Houston's electric utility over allegations of fraud and waste following Hurricane Beryl, adding to the mounting scrutiny after widespread power outages left millions without electricity for days.
“If the investigation uncovers unlawful activity, that activity will be met with the full force of the law.”The utility pledged its support of the investigation.
CenterPoint has largely defended its storm preparedness and said that it deployed thousands of additional workers to help restore power.
Beryl damaged power lines and uprooted trees when it made its Texas landfall on July 8.
Many residents fear that chronic outages have become the norm after Texas’ power grid failed amid a deadly winter storm in 2021.

title: Japan is bracing for a once - in - a - century earthquake . Does it need to ? - LocalNews8 . com
message:
A special committee warned that another “major earthquake” could hit in the coming week – the first time in its history the body had issued this type of nationwide advisory.
Then there’s the looming threat of the Nankai Trough megathrust earthquake – the most powerful of its kind, with magnitudes that can exceed 9.
Japan’s government has warned of the possible Nankai Trough quake for so many years that the possibility of it occurring has become common knowledge.
However, he had no doubt that “a major earthquake will occur in this area” in the future.
“I tell (my students), the Nankai Trough earthquake will definitely come, whether it’s your generation or your children’s generation,” he said.

title: Two Strong Earthquakes Hit Maluku Region in Eight Hours , No Tsunami Potential
message:
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Meteorology, Climatology, and Geophysics Agency (BMKG) reported that two strong earthquakes with a magnitude of 5.0 and above rocked Maluku and North Maluku with an interval of about eight hours.
The first earthquake hit the Batang Dua Island area, Ternate, North Maluku, on Monday evening, August 12, 2024, at 06:36 p.m. WIB (Western Indonesia Time).
"By considering the epicenter and hypocenter, the earthquake was a medium earthquake due to rock deformation activity in the Maluku Sea Plate.
Meanwhile, in the early hours of Tuesday, August 13, 2024, a 5.3 magnitude earthquake jolted the Banda Sea area, West Seram, Maluku.
Based on the estimated shakemap, this earthquake caused tremors in the Amahai, Damer, and Huamual areas with an intensity scale of III MMI.

message:

title: Little fanfare for mid - August
message:
ALBANY, Ga. (WALB) - Thanks to a plunge of drier air, not as humid with hot mid-upper 90s on Monday.
The humidity remains at bay a few more days before ramping up late week into the weekend.
Temperatures remains near average with highs low-mid 90s and lows low-mid 70s.
As Ernesto moves away, the projected track turns the storm north where it’ll likely become a hurricane as it nears Bermuda.
To stay up to date on all the latest news as it develops, follow WALB on Facebook and X (Twitter).

title: Did much - needed rain from Debby alleviate drought conditions in DC area ?
message:
Debby brought much-needed rain to the D.C. area, but not enough to pull it out of the ongoing drought.
Debby brought much-needed rain to the D.C. area, but not enough to pull it out of the ongoing drought.
At the Point of Rocks gauge, the ICPRB monitored a threshold of 1,740 cubic feet per second right before the storm.
Whenever it drops to below 2,000 cubic feet per second, the commission goes into daily drought monitoring.
However, that threshold surged to 61,000 cubic feet per second during the peak of the storm, and has now subsided to about 18,000 cubic feet per second.

title: Titan Suspends ESM Operations Following Flooding From Tropical Storm Debby ; Annual Production Guidance Remains Unchanged
message:
VANCOUVER, Aug. 12, 2024 - Titan Mining Corp. (TSX: TI) ("Titan" or the "Company") announces that operations at Titan's Empire State Mine ("ESM") have been temporarily suspended following historic flooding from Tropical Storm Debby.
